reviews.title: A great hotel
reviews.text: This is a very good hotel. It is centrally located, walking distance from Piaza Navono. The staff is extremely friendly, polite and helpful. Breakfast was included in the price and was delicious

reviews.title: Perfect Location
reviews.text: I highly recommend it to everyone who is on a tight budget, but still expects a nice service.

reviews.title: Great little hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in September. You can't ask for a better location. Easy access to all of the major attractions in Rome. All within walking distance. The rooms were typical for a three-star european hotel. The staff was very helpful. I would definitley plan on staying here again while in Rome, particularly if you're looking for a nice price and great location.

reviews.title: Little Gem
reviews.text: A great place to stay. Clean, nice rooms; friendly (and VERY helpful) staff; and great location! We went to Rome for part of our honeymoon- and this hotel was an excellant choice for us.

reviews.title: Rude!
reviews.text: We were late arriving to our hotel by several hours. When we arrived the man at the front desk actually yelled at me that I was late and it was past check in.

He had booked our room and charged us. He said that the hotel was competely booked up now, but he would help us find another hotel in Rome. I was furious I left and found a delightful place a couple of blocks away.

the perfect location for your first visit to roma!
reviews.text: I dont understand why he was yelling at me when he got my money, and the money of who ever was staying in our room.

reviews.title: Great value for money
reviews.text: We stayed at the Smeraldo at the end of January and found it to be superb! The rooms were beautifully presented clean tidy and modern. The staff were very nice and helpful directing us to a lovely restaurant on our first night just around the corner. However the real beauty of the place is its location, I don’t think you can find a better spot. All the major sites are in walking distance and you are the right side of town to pop over the river and spend your evenings in one of the many bars. I would and have recommended this hotel to others and would not even consider staying anywhere else if is come back to Rome.

The Smeraldo is a sparkling clean back alley place near the Campo de' Fiori. The rooms and bathrooms are small but well kept and the main sites of Rome are walkable if you're in any kind of shape. The staff was a little abrupt but the rooftop patio (bring your own wine in the evening) and the neighborhood of shops, bakeries and restaurants more than made up for any slights. This would have been a 3 but for location and value (E120) we give it a 4.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!
Deposit Policy Unflexible and Unfair
reviews.text: In planning our European holiday, my wife and I wanted to spend extra days on our own in several cities, including Rome. We used many sources, including Tripadvisor, to select suitable accommodation in the centre of these historic cities. The Smeraldo stood out as being in a very good location for us, and the comments by other people indicated that it was a very clean, very good service hotel with a commendable record. So we booked it well in advance, fully expecting to follow through on our booking. However, shortly after arriving in Europe, I developed medical complications, and we thought it advisable to return home. As soon as was possible, we cancelled all tour, travel, and hotel bookings. All hotels in other cities had no problem with the cancellations even though their dates were much closer. But not so with the Smeraldo. We were aware after the booking was made that the one night deposit was designated as non-refundable. Our pleading that our case was different got little sympathy and they refused to refund. On my sugestion that they could at least use our deposit as payment in a future booking got the response of a one year limit and only during the slow periods. Not suitable for us. We believe the non-refundable deposit policy of the Smeraldo to be inflexible and unfair, especially considering the booking was still a month away from time of notice. We want to make people aware of this situation in booking this hotel.

reviews.title: Bait and switch?
reviews.text: The Hotel Smeraldo is perfect. It is in a central location right down from a major bus stop where you can catch a bus to just about anywhere (Rome's busses are surprisingly easy to use) and they sell bus tickets at the desk so you don't have to go to a Tabacchi. Despite its central location, it is in a quiet little corner of the area with only a small amount of noise from passing pedestrians (and no car noise). The hotel is beautiful, especially the circular staircase, the rooms are small but clean with no smoke smell (a huge issue with other hotels in Italy), and the breakfast is fairly comprehensive with muesli and yogurt available in addition to pastries. The desk staff was always nice. For the price, this is an incredible value and I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Great hotel - Great location
reviews.text: We made reservations over 4 months ago for Hotel Smeraldo for 3 rooms. Upon arrival, we were told that only 2 of the 3 rooms would be available and that they had made reservations at a hotel nearby for the other room. Fortunately the other hotel was just around the corner however we were very disappointed to be switched to a lower end hotel (2 stars maximum) and expected to pay the same price. Only when we refused, were we offered a lower price. The staff at Smeraldo were not friendly or helpful. I recommend you keep looking unless location is the only thing you care about when staying in Rome.
